questions.text: What ailment did Sam tell Lisa they were going to talk about curing in the State of the Union?
questions.explanation:
Cancer.

	When Lisa asked him why they didn't say it in the speech, Sam told her 'it was just one of those things'.

questions.text: What magazine did Lisa work for?
questions.explanation:
"Vanity Fair".

	Lisa Sherborne (Traylor Howard) worked at "Vanity Fair" and was Sam's ex-fiancée. She was at the White House doing an expose on Sam. In 1998, Sam told Josh that he and Lisa were to be married in September. Lisa didn't like Josh and she broke off her engagement to Sam because he went to work for Bartlet, not because her name would have been Lisa Sherborne-Seaborn.

questions.text: Who was Josh referring to when he asked, "Do you two ever go anywhere separately?"
questions.explanation:
Ed and Larry.

	After Josh made that comment, Ed asked if it was weird and Josh said, "A little weird. Yeah."

questions.text: How many airplanes did Sam tell Lisa that President Roosevelt was going to have produced in the 1940's?
questions.explanation:
50,000.

	When Sam and Lisa were talking, Sam told her that President Roosevelt said the U.S. would produce 50,000 planes in the next four years. The United States ended up producing 100,000 planes.

questions.text: At the time of the State of the Union, how long had it been since the President was censured?
questions.explanation:
Two weeks.

	Sam told Lisa that it got harder to write the State of the Union Address after what happened two weeks ago, and Lisa realized that's when the President was censured.

questions.text: When do Josh's dates start going badly?
options: He's never had a bad date
questions.explanation:
Second date.

	When Josh told Donna that he and Amy were going to take their official first date, Donna said, "Good, 'cause the second date is usually when the wheels of the wagon fall off for you."

questions.text: How many words did Toby tell Donna the Gettysburg Address had?
questions.explanation:
266.

	Donna was having trouble understanding manuals, and when she ran into Toby she asked him how many words were in the Gettysburg Address and the Ten Commandments. Toby said there were 266 words in the Gettysburg Address and 173 in the Ten Commandments. Donna then wanted know why it took 6,000 words to show how a plane ticket was reimbursed.

questions.text: According to Josh, whose fault was it that his date with Amy went badly?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	Toby was blaming it on everyone else, but Josh blamed Toby because he was the one that told Josh that John Tandy was using Amy to get women's votes. Once Amy found that out, she forbade Josh to speak to her.

questions.text: Who said 'So many women, so little charm'?
questions.explanation:
Donna.

	Donna made this comment to Josh because he had made Amy angry, and Joey had walked away from him while they were talking.

questions.text: After getting the numbers from the State of the Union Address, who told someone to get Toby and Sam some pie?
questions.explanation:
President Bartlet.

	The President's numbers went up from 48% to 69% after the State of Union Address. The President was so happy he told someone to get Toby and Sam some pie because they wrote the speech.
